item.title: Amazing Popup Webclient Div
item.dc:creator: @RevengePK RevengePK
item.description:
@RevengePK wrote:

[quote=“Tom, post:27, topic:520421”]You keep messaging me about having this post deleted, so I’ll make it clear here. The answer is no, I’m not going to save you from looking like an idiot because you can’t take a hint of criticism, and this community doesn’t “suck balls” because it isn’t 100% idiot proof. You’ve got a barrier of self-inflicted ignorance that dictates anything that doesn’t bow to your immediate view of the world must “suck balls”. Either repost the code and stop being such a girl, or let the topic sit here and look like an idiot.

They weren’t threatening you with a knife, they were having a discussion about which would be the preferable way to do things. Either repost the code and stop being such a fool or I’ll just lock the topic and then arguably more people will see it. You have the nerve to message me saying this site sucks because I won’t act as your safety net whenever somebody isn’t on their knees admiring your work.

You have until the end of the day, or I’m locking it.[/quote]

That post makes me want to kiss your balls.

Read full topic

item.title: Amazing Popup Webclient Div
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

The OP made me cringe so many times. Deprecated code is bad, RevengePK was helping you with that but you’re an idiotic little brat who cries when someone tells him his mistakes. LEARN FROM YOUR MISTAKES. This is not some idiotic rune locus community where we praise everything you do regardless of how you do it (bearing in mind we are not retarded). If I had seen it before RevengePK had the chances are I would’ve been a lot more severe than him. If you can’t take constructive criticism just hit that logout button, there’s no point in being here at all if you’re going to be like that.

Read full topic

item.title: Amazing Popup Webclient Div
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“Xa, post:19, topic:520421”][quote author=RSCShadow link=topic=638916.msg4306703#msg4306703 date=1369964199]

I’m pointing out problems in the code… I’m allowed to critique. I’m not trolling or anything to be honest. Also,

    <H1>Play Now</h1><BR>
Put Applet stuff Here!       
<BR><BR>

Line breaks should be self closing.
.
[/quote] You actually shouldn’t be using them for “stylistic” purposes at all, but in HTML5,
is perfectly fine,
isn’t though.

What is the difference. I use
and
and it is no different. It does the same thing and I don’t have a problem with it. I code like that, it may not be how you guys code, but I like it and I don’t need to make my code any different. The code worked for me and my friends, so it doesn’t matter. It’s the way I code whether you like it or not.[/quote]Actually I made a mistake, the case of the tags doesn’t affect validity, but it’s good to be consistent. Anyway, just because something works doesn’t mean it’s the best way to do something. RevengePK went over this already. I don’t care how you code, it’ll be your problem for you and others to maintain and it makes you look stupid when you avoid recommended practices and standards.

You shouldn’t use
to change spacing. Your markup should be separated from your styles; use CSS to style your pages and HTML to describe the content of the page.

Read full topic

item.title: Amazing Popup Webclient Div
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“RevengePK, post:10, topic:520421”]I’m pointing out problems in the code… I’m allowed to critique. I’m not trolling or anything to be honest. Also,

    <H1>Play Now</h1><BR>
Put Applet stuff Here!       
<BR><BR>

Line breaks should be self closing.
.[/quote] You actually shouldn’t be using them for “stylistic” purposes at all, but in HTML5,
is perfectly fine,
isn’t though.

EDIT:
is technically valid too.

[quote=“RevengePK, post:10, topic:520421”] <B>Play Now</B>

The bold tag is from the stone-age.

.span { font-weight: bold; }

<span>Bold font</span>

Should work nicely.[/quote]Actually, if he added a class to the bold tag, it would be semantically correct. isn’t deprecated in HTML5 and can still be used.

The HTML Element represents a span of text stylistically different from normal text, without a conveying any special importance or relevance.

Your solution of declaring all tags bold (or for some reason the “span” class) is less semantically correct.

[quote=“RevengePK, post:10, topic:520421”] box-shadow: 0px 0px 20px #999; -moz-box-shadow: 0px 0px 20px #999; -webkit-box-shadow: 0px 0px 20px #999; border-radius:3px 3px 3px 3px; -moz-border-radius: 3px; -webkit-border-radius: 3px;

Deprecated code.

box-shadow: 0 0 5px #000;

or

border-radius: 3px;

Should work fine.[/quote]It depends if he wants to be supporting older versions of browsers which some people may still be on. His order is wrong though.

Read full topic

item.title: Amazing Popup Webclient Div
item.dc:creator: @RevengePK RevengePK
item.description:
@RevengePK wrote:

[quote=“Xa, post:14, topic:520421”][quote author=RevengePK link=topic=638916.msg4306682#msg4306682 date=1369959742]

$id = $_GET['id'];

index.php?id='.$id.'

Works but is vulnerable to attacks. Kay. (If you don’t see the connection don’t respond.) PM a moderator or something and request this removed.
[/quote]
Where TF did you get that code?[/quote]

What I’m trying to compare here is, it may work, but it’s not the right or, in the $_GET case, safest way. I was simple comparing the situation to another situation that is a bit more blatant.

Read full topic

He’s being very kind to you.

item.title: Amazing Popup Webclient Div
item.dc:creator: @RevengePK RevengePK
item.description:
@RevengePK wrote:

I’m pointing out problems in the code… I’m allowed to critique. I’m not trolling or anything to be honest. Also,

    <H1>Play Now</h1><BR>
Put Applet stuff Here!       
<BR><BR>

Line breaks should be self closing.
.

        z-index: 10;
        width: 100%; height: 100%;
        opacity: 0.8;
        z-index: 999;

You have z-index declared twice. The second one will be put into effect because the files are read top to bottom.

<B>Play Now</B>

The bold tag is from the stone-age.

.span { font-weight: bold; }

<span>Bold font</span>

Should work nicely.

        box-shadow: 0px 0px 20px #999;
        -moz-box-shadow: 0px 0px 20px #999;
    -webkit-box-shadow: 0px 0px 20px #999;
        border-radius:3px 3px 3px 3px;
    -moz-border-radius: 3px;
    -webkit-border-radius: 3px;

Deprecated code.

box-shadow: 0 0 5px #000;

or

border-radius: 3px;

Should work fine.

And last but not least, this makes me think you stole the code:

  $('#playnow').live('click', function() {
          $('#playnow , .webclient-popup').fadeOut(300 , function() {
                $('#playnow').remove(); 
        });
        return false;
        });

Read full topic

item.title: Amazing Popup Webclient Div
item.dc:creator: @Xa1 Xa
item.description:
@Xa1 wrote:

[quote=“RevengePK, post:4, topic:520421”]It was a useful comment, it was me wondering where the “amazing” is. From what I can see, this is a very basic attempt at a lightbox.

Also,

    <script src="http://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.5.0/jquery.min.js" type="text/javascript"></script>
        <script type="text/javascript" src="http://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.6.2/jquery.min.js"></script>

Explain why you did this…[/quote]
It was in my code with my website, I just copied it over.

It’s also still a useless comment, I never said you had to be amazed. You’re obviously being a whiny picky person.

Read full topic
